subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: The command example demonstrates the use of SchemaCrawler from the shell command line.

ol.li: Make sure that the Java executable is on your path. (J2SE 6 or better is required.)
Start the database server by running StartDatabaseServer script from the distribution directory.
Start a command shell in the commandline example directory.
Run sc.cmd -help (or sc.sh -help on Unix). This will give you a list of available command line options.
To start with, run sc.cmd -infolevel=minimum -command=list (or sc.sh -infolevel=minimum -command=list on Unix)

Take a look at the SchemaCrawler grep example, in the
grep
example directory.

Take a look at the SchemaCrawler lint example, in the
lint
example directory.
Try modifying the schemacrawler.config.properties file with regular expressions, logging, and so on.
Try using different SchemaCrawler command line options.
Redirect the output of SchemaCrawler into a file, by running sc.cmd > file.txt .
Try defining a new database connection, using your favorite database and driver.
